content.description: Worth the hike! 15+ moves of world class compression! Left hand edges and crimps and right hand lazer cut arete holds. Start low down with often damp left hand and positive right hand arete. Heel hook and squeeze up the feature culminating in a hard sequence to gain the flat rail. Find some face holds out right to make a final yank to the jug ledge up high. Top out by climbing the lichen to the summit or just roll up onto the jug ledge and scamper off. Note: Slight condensation is not uncommon in this little alcove but chalk and a rag will do the trick.Â
Huge boulder with long overhung face tucked away up high.  Home to one of the best hard problems in the area. The approach is a bit of a haul.
